record.author: Palmer, Bill (2004) Uruava dictionary, Additions from Piet Lincoln
record.notes: Palmer's dictionary is an exhaustive compilation from older sources. Uruava is an extinct language of Bougainville. Missing items are probably lost for ever.
record.problems: Sources diagree as to whether Palmers <g> represents [g] or [ŋ]. Palmer assumes [g].
record.classification: Austronesian, Malayo-Polynesian, Central-Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Oceanic, Western Oceanic, Meso Melanesian, New Ireland, South New Ireland-Northwest Solomonic, Mono-Uruava

record.annotation: to fight (esp. humans) - two plural men each.other-hit
PCL: possibly Japanese loan? <sigoto> but collected 1939 before J occupation.
swelling, boil (PCL: in context of disease)
beat sago to produce sago water
